data.title: John Rorick on LinkedIn: HelloFresh x Neil Patrick Harris and David Burtka
data.meta_description: I will refrain from dating myself with a Doogie Howser reference :), but this is yet another great partnership for HelloFresh as we continue to grow our‚Ä¶
data.text:
No one looked like Ana Garcia in meetings. What she did next changed her life. She let her boss know how that made her feel. He listened. Together, they drove lasting change at their company. Fast forward several years... Now Ana leads the People team at HelloFresh.üöÄ She has: ‚Ü≥ Shattered her limiting beliefs to now leading a multi-billion dollar organization. ‚Ü≥ Found a career where she makes an impact everyday. ‚Ü≥ Built an inclusive and diverse culture. She‚Äôs helped elevate hundreds of women at HelloFresh with Arise Leadership . There are now people who look like her and others.üíï Want to know exactly how she got to the top? Tune in with me and Ana as she reveals the raw details of her bumpy career journey. üóìÔ∏è Mark your calendars: April 4th. Fireside chat (virtual) Ana is a role model for breaking limiting beliefs and standing up for ourselves.üëè üëáRegister now and save your free spot. Link is in the comments.

üåü Exciting Opportunity to Join the HelloFresh Team! üåü At HelloFresh, we believe in the power of great people coming together to create something extraordinary. Today, we're thrilled to share an in-depth look at the heartbeat of our operation and what happens daily in our facilities! We are more than just a company; we are a team, and our team plays a crucial role in shaping the HelloFresh experience. In this video, witness the dedication, teamwork, and passion that define our distribution team. Why join HelloFresh? - Be a part of a global movement changing how people eat. - Work in a supportive and inclusive environment where your contributions are valued. - Enjoy exciting growth opportunities and career development. Ready to be a part of something extraordinary? Check out the video and discover why joining HelloFresh means becoming a valued member of our ever-growing team! Apply now, and let's create amazing meal experiences together! üçΩÔ∏è #HelloFresh #JoinOurFamily #DistributionTeam #CareerOpportunities #WorkWithUs #TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork

As we celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month, we at HelloFresh have partnered with our Employee Resource Group LIMES (Leveraging Inclusivity for Minority Employee Success) to highlight incredible employees who not only make a difference company-wide but in the community. Today, we‚Äôd like you to meet Casey Arzola, Talent Acquisition Manager for HelloFresh US in our Boulder, CO Headquarters. Casey, a second-generation latino, is an alum of Fort Hayes University. He started his career with HelloFresh in 2022 . Casey has made such an impact on his team and a huge difference in LIMES. We sat down with him to get his perspective on his upbringing & and what Hispanic Heritage Month means to him: ‚ÄúHispanic Heritage Month is a fantastic month to celebrate our heritage and showcase all the great people that make up the community in the US. While being able to tell stories from different backgrounds, and origins. Latinos today continue to advance communities across the country as small business owners, veterans, teachers, and public servants, among many other professions. My parents were both born in Mexico. My Mother and Father immigrated together to Chicago in search of a better life. My Mom left Chicago to be closer to her sister in Kansas. Like most Hispanic families we were around, we had strong close-knit family ties with cousins/relatives. Growing up around family was very important to our family. Celebrating all different occasions, quincea√±eras, birthdays, holidays, etc. My mother has been a huge influence in both my brother's and I's lives. Coming from Mexico and not knowing any English, she taught herself to read and write English by reading and taking in the information we were given to learn English. A very strong-willed woman, who is no doubt one of the hardest-working people in my life. Her resiliency and work ethic was showcased to us while growing up. It still stands in our attitudes, in how we approach everything in life. As we got older, my mother became an Assistant Principal at a GED school, helping people like herself achieve their goals of getting the GED. I'm proud of the values she instilled in me as a man but more importantly the value of what it means to never give up and to always strive for more!.‚Äù Thank you for sharing your story Casey! #DEIatHF #HHM
